parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Very sorrowful, greatly grieved. From peri and lupe; grieved all around, i.e. Intensely sad.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
With difficulty, hardly. Adverb from duskolos; impracticably.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Money, riches, possessions. Something useful or needed, i.e. Wealth, price.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To journey in(to), I go in(to), enter, intervene. From eis and poreuomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
